title: Dow Jones Futures Rise As Coronavirus Stock Market Rally Rotation Continues; China OKs Hong Kong Security Law
summary:
XThe coronavirus stock market rally powered ahead Wednesday, with real world sectors such as airlines, retailers and banks outperforming for a second day.
Several winners in the coronavirus stock market rally are finding bullish support at key levels.
ServiceNow stock, Microsoft stock, Google stock and Workday stock tested support near buy points, with NOW and MSFT stock also bouncing somewhat from their 21-day lines.
Dow Jones Futures TodayDow Jones futures rose 0.75% vs. fair value.
Coronavirus Stock Market RallyThe coronavirus stock market rally started off poorly for growth stocks, but the major indexes gained momentum in the afternoon, closing at session highs.
text:
Dow Jones futures and S&P 500 rose Thursday morning, while Nasdaq futures turned lower. China went ahead and passed a national security law over Hong Kong, defying the U.S. Boeing (BA) resumed 737 Max production, giving Dow futures a lift.

X

The coronavirus stock market rally powered ahead Wednesday, with real world sectors such as airlines, retailers and banks outperforming for a second day.

The Nasdaq rebounded for solid gains while Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX), Netflix (NFLX), Google parent Alphabet (GOOGL), Microsoft (MSFT), Tesla (TSLA), ServiceNow (NOW) and Regeneron (REGN) staged bullish reversals.

Boeing 737 Max Production Resumes

Boeing 737 Max production has resumed, though the ailing jet is still grounded. The Dow Jones aerospace giant halted 737 Max production in late January, as orders plunged. Air travel has plunged during the coronavirus crisis, bringing jet orders overall to a virtual halt. Restarting Boeing 737 Max production likely indicates the company sees regulators giving the go-ahead for flights soon. Boeing stock popped 4% overnight. It's also positive for Boeing suppliers, as well as manufacturing and the U.S. economy generally.

Meanwhile, Autodesk (ADSK) and Workday (WDAY) reported earnings after the close. Autodesk stock fell modestly while Workday stock spiked after closing in buy range.

Catch Up Market Rally

The Nasdaq had been getting extended vs. the Dow Jones and S&P 500 index, as tech stocks thrived or held up well during the coronavirus shutdowns. With states reopening businesses and coronavirus vaccine hopes rising, sectors benefiting from an economic recovery are doing well.

So far, the S&P 500 is catching up rather than the Nasdaq tumbling. Several winners in the coronavirus stock market rally are finding bullish support at key levels. That could offer new buying opportunities for investors who may have missed out on the initial breakouts.

Bullish Reversals

Vertex stock, Regeneron stock and Netflix stock staged strong upside reversals, flashing buy signals. ServiceNow stock, Microsoft stock, Google stock and Workday stock tested support near buy points, with NOW and MSFT stock also bouncing somewhat from their 21-day lines.

Tesla stock bounced off its 21-day moving line, providing a mini-shakeout. TSLA stock is just below a buy point.

Vertex stock is on IBD Leaderboard, along with ServiceNow stock and Microsoft stock. Tesla stock is on the Leaderboard watchlist. REGN stock, VRTX stock and Google stock are on SwingTrader.

MSFT stock and NOW stock are on the Long-Term Leaders list, while GOOGL stock is on the Long-Term Leaders watchlist.

Vertex stock, ServiceNow stock and Netflix stock are on the IBD 50 list. So are Autodesk stock and Workday stock.

Dow Jones Futures Today

Dow Jones futures rose 0.75% vs. fair value. S&P 500 futures climbed 0.3%. Boeing stock is giving a modest boost to the Dow Jones and S&P 500. Nasdaq 100 futures sank 0.8%. Remember that overnight action in Dow futures and elsewhere doesn't necessarily translate into actual trading in the next regular stock market session.

China went ahead and approved major national security legislation for Hong Kong, which local protesters will chill freedom in the city. President Donald Trump has threatened to respond strong to the law.

On Wednesday Secretary of State Mike Pompeo notified Congress on Wednesday that Hong Kong is no longer "autonomous" from China. That signals Hong Kong could lose its special trading status with the U.S.

Join IBD experts as they analyze actionable stocks in the coronavirus stock market rally on IBD Live.

Coronavirus News

Coronavirus cases worldwide have topped 5.81 million. Covid-19 deaths are above 357,000.

Coronavirus cases in the U.S. have hit 1.74 million, with deaths of at least 102,000.

Brazil is a major coronavirus hot spot, with new cases outpacing U.S. infections on Wednesday. Russia, India as well as the Mideast and many other South American countries in addition to Brazil are reporting big increases in new cases.

Coronavirus Stock Market Rally

The coronavirus stock market rally started off poorly for growth stocks, but the major indexes gained momentum in the afternoon, closing at session highs.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped 2.2%. The S&P 500 index climbed 1.5%, closing above its 200-day moving average for the first time since March 4. The Nasdaq composite rose 0.8% after falling as much as 2.1%.

Among the best ETFs, the Innovator IBD 50 ETF (FFTY) dipped 0.2%. The iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) was just below break-even. Microsoft stock and ServiceNow stock are major components. The VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF (SMH) rallied 1.5%. Micron Technology (MU) reversed higher in the midafternoon, closing up 8% on bullish guidance.

Vertex Stock

Vertex stock fell as low as 254.41 Wednesday morning, touching the 50-day line. VRTX stock then surged to close up 4.5% at 278.51.

Regeneron Stock

Regeneron stock hit 522.02 intraday, slightly undercutting the 50-day line for the first time since early February. REGN stock roared back to close off only 0.2% at 544.01.

Netflix Stock

Netflix stock extended a recent slide intraday, hitting 397.86. That undercut the 50-day line as it fell to just above the top of Netflix's old base. NFLX bounced to close up 1.2% to 419.89, also trading above its 10-week line.

ServiceNow Stock

ServiceNow sank to 352.15 intraday, knifing through a 363.05 cup-base buy point and its 21-day line. By the close, NOW stock pared its loss to down 2.5% to 371.16, back in buy range.

Microsoft Stock

Microsoft stock slid to 176.60 intraday, below its 180.10 handle buy point and its 21-day line. But MSFT stock finished up 0.1% at 181.81. Microsoft stock hasn't closed below its 21-day since April 1. Investors could buy the Dow Jones tech giant, or wait until MSFT stock gets above an alternate entry of 187.61.

Google Stock

Google stock fell to 1,394.60 intraday, but recovered to close down 0.1% at 1,420.28, holding above a 1415.63 cup-with-handle entry, according to MarketSmith.

Tesla Stock

Tesla stock fell to 785 intraday, testing its 21-day line and providing some shakeout in a handle that was wedging higher in some respects. By the end of day, TSLA stock closed up 0.2% at 820.23. The official buy point is 869.92, though 843.39 is one potential early entry.

Late Tuesday, Tesla cut prices on its Model 3, Model S and Model X vehicles in North America and Europe to spur demand. It's also cutting prices in China for imported Model S and Model X vehicles. That's despite the Tesla Fremont plant being shut down for nearly two months.

Tesla stock fell 1% overnight, likely due to sister company SpaceX scrapping a Wednesday launch due to bad weather. The historic spaceflight, a manned private spaceship to the International Space Station, moves to Saturday.

Autodesk Earnings

Autodesk earnings shot up 89% to 85 cents a share with revenue up 20% to $885.7 million. Analysts had projected Autodesk earnings of 81 cents on sales of $735.5 million.

The computer-aided design software maker gave some weak guidance.

Autodesk stock fell more than 1% before the open. Shares rose 0.1% to 199.81 on Wednesday, extended from a 189.96 entry.

Workday Earnings

Workday earnings came in at 44 cents a share vs. 43 cents a year earlier. Revenue swelled 23% to $1.02 billion. Wall Street had expected Workday earnings of 37 cents on $1 billion in sales. The human resources and financial management software maker cut full-year subscription revenue targets.

But Workday stock jumped 5% in the premarket. Shares closed up 1.2% to 170.38, just above a 168.85 cup-with-handle buy point, after trying to break out in the prior two sessions. WDAY stock undercut its 200-day line intraday, hitting 162.66 before rebounding. Workday stock is still well below its February peak of 202 and its July 2019 all-time high of 226.83.

As the past two days have shown, highflying growth stocks can rack up big gains quickly in the coronavirus stock market rally, but they can come down even faster.

<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/stock-market-today/" rel="category tag">Stock Market Today</a></li></ul> <h1 class="header1">
Dow Jones Futures Rise As Coronavirus Market Rally Rotation Continues; China OKs Hong Kong Security Law	</h1>
<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">
<div class="share">
<div class="a2a_kit a2a_kit_size_25 addtoany_list" data-a2a-url="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/dow-jones-futures-vertex-netflix-tesla-rebound-coronavirus-stock-market-rally/" data-a2a-title="Dow Jones Futures Rise As Coronavirus Market Rally Rotation Continues; China OKs Hong Kong Security Law"><a class="a2a_button_facebook" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/facebook?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fmarket-trend%2Fstock-market-today%2Fdow-jones-futures-vertex-netflix-tesla-rebound-coronavirus-stock-market-rally%2F&linkname=Dow%20Jones%20Futures%20Rise%20As%20Coronavirus%20Market%20Rally%20Rotation%20Continues%3B%20China%20OKs%20Hong%20Kong%20Security%20Law" title="Facebook" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/facebook.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Facebook"></a><a class="a2a_button_twitter" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/twitter?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fmarket-trend%2Fstock-market-today%2Fdow-jones-futures-vertex-netflix-tesla-rebound-coronavirus-stock-market-rally%2F&linkname=Dow%20Jones%20Futures%20Rise%20As%20Coronavirus%20Market%20Rally%20Rotation%20Continues%3B%20China%20OKs%20Hong%20Kong%20Security%20Law" title="Twitter" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/twitter.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Twitter"></a><a class="a2a_button_linkedin" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/linkedin?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fmarket-trend%2Fstock-market-today%2Fdow-jones-futures-vertex-netflix-tesla-rebound-coronavirus-stock-market-rally%2F&linkname=Dow%20Jones%20Futures%20Rise%20As%20Coronavirus%20Market%20Rally%20Rotation%20Continues%3B%20China%20OKs%20Hong%20Kong%20Security%20Law" title="LinkedIn" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/linkedin.png" width="25" height="25" alt="LinkedIn"></a><a class="a2a_dd addtoany_share_save addtoany_share" href="https://www.addtoany.com/share"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/email.png" alt="Share"></a></div> <a class="reprints-button sharing" href="https://www.ibdlicensing.com" target="_blank">Licensing</a>
</div>
<ul class="post-meta">
<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/carsone/" title="Posts by ED CARSON" class="author url fn" rel="author">ED CARSON</a></span></li>
<li class="post-time">08:14 AM ET 05/28/2020</li>
</ul>
</div>
</header>
<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>Dow Jones futures and S&P 500 rose Thursday morning, while Nasdaq futures turned lower. China went ahead and passed a national security law over Hong Kong, defying the U.S. <strong>Boeing</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=BA' target='_blank'>BA</a>) resumed 737 Max production, giving Dow futures a lift.</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5866954" vid-dom-id="5866954-5ed70d08b4ac9" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/sheeaPRO.m3u8" data-captions="[{"name":"English","url":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/tracks\/K0Pm9hV2"}]" vid-name="Nasdaq Finds Support; S&P 500 Reclaims 3000; Upside Reversals Are Plentiful" vid-cat="Stock Market Today" vid-date="05/27/2020" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/sheeaPRO-640x360.jpg" vid-authors="ALISSA CORAM, JUSTIN NIELSEN">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-5866954-5ed70d08b4ac9" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Nasdaq Finds Support; S&P 500 Reclaims 3000; Upside Reversals Are Plentiful","description":"Stocks find support and reverse off lows; a tale of two markets.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/sheeaPRO-640x360.jpg","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/sheeaPRO.m3u8","uploadDate":"2020-05-27T14:12:59+0000","duration":"PT595.00S","author":"ALISSA CORAM, JUSTIN NIELSEN","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p>The coronavirus stock market rally powered ahead Wednesday, with real world sectors such as airlines, retailers and banks outperforming for a second day.</p>
<p>The Nasdaq rebounded for solid gains while <strong>Vertex Pharmaceuticals</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=VRTX' target='_blank'>VRTX</a>), <strong>Netflix</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NFLX' target='_blank'>NFLX</a>), Google parent <strong>Alphabet</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=GOOGL' target='_blank'>GOOGL</a>), <strong>Microsoft</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT' target='_blank'>MSFT</a>), <strong>Tesla</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TSLA' target='_blank'>TSLA</a>), <strong>ServiceNow</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NOW' target='_blank'>NOW</a>) and <strong>Regeneron</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=REGN' target='_blank'>REGN</a>) staged bullish reversals.</p>
<h2>Boeing 737 Max Production Resumes</h2>
<p><a href="https://www.investors.com/news/boeing-stock-aerospace-giants-faa-cdc-discuss-safe-air-travel/">Boeing 737 Max production</a> has resumed, though the ailing jet is still grounded. The Dow Jones aerospace giant halted 737 Max production in late January, as orders plunged. Air travel has plunged during the coronavirus crisis, bringing jet orders overall to a virtual halt. Restarting Boeing 737 Max production likely indicates the company sees regulators giving the go-ahead for flights soon. Boeing stock popped 4% overnight. It's also positive for Boeing suppliers, as well as manufacturing and the U.S. economy generally.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, <strong>Autodesk</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=ADSK' target='_blank'>ADSK</a>) and <strong>Workday</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=WDAY' target='_blank'>WDAY</a>) reported earnings after the close. Autodesk stock fell modestly while Workday stock spiked after closing in buy range.</p>
<h2>Catch Up Market Rally</h2>
<p>The Nasdaq had been getting extended vs. the Dow Jones and S&P 500 index, as tech stocks thrived or held up well during the coronavirus shutdowns. With states reopening businesses and coronavirus vaccine hopes rising, sectors benefiting from an economic recovery are doing well.</p>
<p>So far, the S&P 500 is catching up rather than the Nasdaq tumbling. Several winners in the coronavirus stock market rally are finding bullish support at key levels. That could offer new buying opportunities for investors who may have missed out on the initial breakouts.</p>
<h2>Bullish Reversals</h2>
<p>Vertex stock, Regeneron stock and Netflix stock staged strong upside reversals, flashing buy signals. ServiceNow stock, Microsoft stock, Google stock and Workday stock tested support near buy points, with NOW and MSFT stock also bouncing somewhat from their 21-day lines.</p>
<p>Tesla stock bounced off its 21-day moving line, providing a mini-shakeout. TSLA stock is just below a buy point.</p>
<p>Vertex stock is on <a href="https://leaderboard.investors.com/#/leaders/leadersnearabuypoint">IBD Leaderboard</a>, along with ServiceNow stock and Microsoft stock. Tesla stock is on the Leaderboard watchlist. REGN stock, VRTX stock and Google stock are on <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/swingtrader/?artProdLink=Swingtrader">SwingTrader</a>.</p>
<p>MSFT stock and NOW stock are on the <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">Long-Term Leaders list</a>, while GOOGL stock is on the Long-Term Leaders watchlist.</p>
<p>Vertex stock, ServiceNow stock and Netflix stock are on the <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-lists/ibd-50/">IBD 50 list</a>. So are Autodesk stock and Workday stock.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Futures Today</h2>
<p>Dow Jones futures rose 0.75% vs. fair value. S&P 500 futures climbed 0.3%. Boeing stock is giving a modest boost to the Dow Jones and S&P 500. Nasdaq 100 futures sank 0.8%. Remember that overnight action in <a href="http://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/stock-futures-premarket-dow-futures-sp-futures-nasdaq-futures/">Dow futures</a> and elsewhere doesn't necessarily translate into actual trading in the next regular <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/stock-market-data-dow-jones-sp-500-nasdaq-spdr-etfs/">stock market</a> session.</p>
<p>China went ahead and approved major national security legislation for Hong Kong, which local protesters will chill freedom in the city. President Donald Trump has threatened to respond strong to the law.</p>
<p>On Wednesday Secretary of State Mike Pompeo notified Congress on Wednesday that Hong Kong is no longer "autonomous" from China. That signals Hong Kong could lose its special trading status with the U.S.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://shop.investors.com/offer/splashresponsive.aspx?id=IBD-Live&src=A00433A&refcode=pdsoc%7Cggl%7Cibdlive%7C2019%7C11%7Cibdlive%7Cna%7C985802&intcode=invstcntnartcls|cms|ibdlive|2019|11|ibdlive|na|682843"><strong>Join IBD experts as they analyze actionable stocks in the coronavirus stock market rally on IBD Live.</strong></a></p>
<hr />
<h2>Coronavirus News</h2>
<p>Coronavirus cases worldwide have topped 5.81 million. Covid-19 deaths are above 357,000.</p>
<p>Coronavirus cases in the U.S. have hit 1.74 million, with deaths of at least 102,000.</p>
<p>Brazil is a major coronavirus hot spot, with new cases outpacing U.S. infections on Wednesday. Russia, India as well as the Mideast and many other South American countries in addition to Brazil are reporting big increases in new cases.</p>
<h2>Coronavirus Stock Market Rally</h2>
<p>The coronavirus stock market rally started off poorly for growth stocks, but the major indexes gained momentum in the afternoon, closing at session highs.</p>
<p>The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped 2.2%. The S&P 500 index climbed 1.5%, closing above its 200-day moving average for the first time since March 4. The Nasdaq composite rose 0.8% after falling as much as 2.1%.</p>
<p>Among the <a href="https://www.investors.com/etfs-and-funds/etfs/best-etfs-exchange-traded-funds/">best ETFs</a>, the Innovator IBD 50 ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FFTY' target='_blank'>FFTY</a>) dipped 0.2%. The iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=IGV' target='_blank'>IGV</a>) was just below break-even. Microsoft stock and ServiceNow stock are major components. The VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=SMH' target='_blank'>SMH</a>) rallied 1.5%. <strong>Micron Technology</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MU' target='_blank'>MU</a>) reversed higher in the midafternoon, closing up 8% on bullish guidance.</p>
<h2>Vertex Stock</h2>
<p>Vertex stock fell as low as 254.41 Wednesday morning, touching the 50-day line. VRTX stock then surged to close up 4.5% at 278.51.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=vrtx'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Regeneron Stock</h2>
<p>Regeneron stock hit 522.02 intraday, slightly undercutting the 50-day line for the first time since early February. REGN stock roared back to close off only 0.2% at 544.01.</p>
<h2>Netflix Stock</h2>
<p>Netflix stock extended a recent slide intraday, hitting 397.86. That undercut the 50-day line as it fell to just above the top of Netflix's old base. NFLX bounced to close up 1.2% to 419.89, also trading above its 10-week line.</p>
<h2>ServiceNow Stock</h2>
<p>ServiceNow sank to 352.15 intraday, knifing through a 363.05 cup-base <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a> and its 21-day line. By the close, NOW stock pared its loss to down 2.5% to 371.16, back in buy range.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=now'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Microsoft Stock</h2>
<p>Microsoft stock slid to 176.60 intraday, below its 180.10 handle buy point and its 21-day line. But MSFT stock finished up 0.1% at 181.81. Microsoft stock hasn't closed below its 21-day since April 1. Investors could buy the Dow Jones tech giant, or wait until MSFT stock gets above an alternate entry of 187.61.</p>
<h2>Google Stock</h2>
<p>Google stock fell to 1,394.60 intraday, but recovered to close down 0.1% at 1,420.28, holding above a 1415.63 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-buy-stocks-cup-with-handle-base-alibaba-stock-buy-point/">cup-with-handle</a> entry, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith">MarketSmith</a>.</p>
<h2>Tesla Stock</h2>
<p>Tesla stock fell to 785 intraday, testing its 21-day line and providing some shakeout in a handle that was wedging higher in some respects. By the end of day, TSLA stock closed up 0.2% at 820.23. The official buy point is 869.92, though 843.39 is one potential early entry.</p>
<p>Late Tuesday, Tesla cut prices on its Model 3, Model S and Model X vehicles in North America and Europe to spur demand. It's also cutting prices in China for imported Model S and Model X vehicles. That's despite the Tesla Fremont plant being shut down for nearly two months.</p>
<p>Tesla stock fell 1% overnight, likely due to sister company <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/spacex-launch-commercial-crew-dragon-astronauts-international-space-station/">SpaceX scrapping a Wednesday launch</a> due to bad weather. The historic spaceflight, a manned private spaceship to the International Space Station, moves to Saturday.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=tsla'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Autodesk Earnings</h2>
<p>Autodesk earnings shot up 89% to 85 cents a share with revenue up 20% to $885.7 million. Analysts had projected Autodesk earnings of 81 cents on sales of $735.5 million.</p>
<p>The computer-aided design software maker gave some weak guidance.</p>
<p>Autodesk stock fell more than 1% before the open. Shares rose 0.1% to 199.81 on Wednesday, extended from a 189.96 entry.</p>
<h2>Workday Earnings</h2>
<p>Workday earnings came in at 44 cents a share vs. 43 cents a year earlier. Revenue swelled 23% to $1.02 billion. Wall Street had expected Workday earnings of 37 cents on $1 billion in sales. The human resources and financial management software maker cut full-year subscription revenue targets.</p>
<p>But Workday stock jumped 5% in the premarket. Shares closed up 1.2% to 170.38, just above a 168.85 cup-with-handle buy point, after trying to break out in the prior two sessions. WDAY stock undercut its 200-day line intraday, hitting 162.66 before rebounding. Workday stock is still well below its February peak of 202 and its July 2019 all-time high of 226.83.</p>
<p>As the past two days have shown, highflying growth stocks can rack up big gains quickly in the coronavirus stock market rally, but they can come down even faster.</p>
